lexUnit.name: counter.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: speak or act in opposition or response to.

sentence.text: ` Yes , " she countered abruptly , hugging her arms round herself , wishing she could sprout wings and fly somewhere private to live down her intense humiliation .
` I 'm paying you , are n't I ? " he countered angrily .
` Well , she 's probably realized that Tom is n't very well off and Mr Davies is , " Nina countered bitterly .
` And since we 're exchanging personal details , Rune Christensen , " she countered briskly , ` what about you ?
` They wo n't come , " Anita counters calmly .
` Why ever not ? " she countered calmly , fighting down the dismay threatening to overwhelm her .
` Well , I 'm in a respectable dress , " she countered coolly .
` Does it matter ? " she countered defeatedly .
` Why do you want to know ? " she countered evenly .
` But you were a virgin -- that much was true , " Travis countered hardily .
` Hardly surprising , is it ? " she countered lightly , determined to disguise her apprehension .
` Of course not , " she countered politely , meeting the smiling eyes of the hovering waiter with a touch more warmth in her face .
` I was just about to ask the same of you , " he countered promptly .
` Maybe we are not always that good ourselves if we look closer , " Rose countered quickly .
I have read your work , " he countered quietly .
` What was there that I could possibly object to ? " she countered smoothly .
` I did n't think our destination mattered as long as it was private , " Luke countered smoothly as he switched on the light , but Maria did n't believe him .
` You talk as if desire were one-sided , " he countered softly , ` as if it is only I who wants you .
` You presume to worry about your mother 's safety , " he countered thoughtfully , ` yet you are indignant when the tables are turned ? "
` Which one ? " countered Nessie with a smile .
` What did we talk about when we were in Three A ? " she countered , and all three racked their brains in vain .
But England manager Graham Taylor countered : ` I ca n't see how he can say such things without having an intimate knowledge of our game .
Quorum counters that Apple can not assert any ownership of application source code created by ISVs .
She countered , smilingly behind the menu : ` The French have a different attitude to rape : resistance is the salt on the dish , you know . "
` And what was I supposed to do ? " she countered .
` Not without doubt at all , " Rose countered .
` A year , " she countered .
` Well , I prescribe aspirin , " he countered .
` Which makes you equally unworthy , " Maria countered .
But the health watchdogs have countered that one person can not be expected to be on call all the time , and that person might also not be available .
Hanoi conservatives counter by pointing out that what the economy needs most -- cash -- will not come immediately , and not at all if the ceasefire breaks down .

The Controller had countered by pointing out that the loss of the street trade alone in the Manhattan area , until control and distribution could be re-established , would cost them millions in lost revenue .
Hugh Gaitskell countered by promising that the Labour Party would make improvements in the Welfare State and increase pensions without increasing taxation .
The clubs countered by saying they would boycott a scheduled meeting between the WRU 's competition sub-committee and the leagues working party .
` A source close to Mr Heseltine " swiftly countered with ` That is a lie . "
` Interesting , " she countered in soft annoyance , ` but arrogant . "
You talk with all the the typical arrogance of the male ! she countered in a choked voice .
Do n't be so patronising , she countered in a low , angry voice .
` How dare you come here trying to put me off my guard with some absurd story ? " he countered with simmering hostility , regarding her belligerent stance with brooding interest .
He thanked her but countered cunningly with a query about who her friends might be .
Gerald countered with a question of his own : ` Has the Big Chief grilled you yet ? "
Instead of replying , Anna countered with a question of her own .
` If there 's only one governing authority , you ca n't nationalise -- only internationalise , " he countered with a twinkle .
` Do you have any objection to my presence here ? " countered the old man .
` A long whatsit , " countered Nigel , beginning to bristle .
